Package controller

Class CustomerRecords

java.lang.Object
controller.CustomerRecords
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomerRecords extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class controls the application window for the CustomerRecords.fxml screen.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The initialize method sets up the screen on launch. It initializes all necessary Observable Lists and sets the items in the table view. It also collects the user information from the AppointmentView controller.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onAddCust

      public void onAddCust(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onAddCust method loads the Add Customer screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Add Customer" button click on the Customer Records screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading AddCustomer.fxml happens.

    • onModCust

      public void onModCust(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onModCust method loads the Modify Customer screen and passes it the selected customer from the table view. Error checking is in place to ensure a customer is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Modify Customer" button click on the Customer Records screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading ModifyCustomer.fxml happens.

    • onDeleteCust

      public void onDeleteCust(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      The onDeleteCust method confirms that the user wants to delete the selected customer and removes it from the database upon confirmation. Error checking is in place to ensure a customer is selected and that no appointments are connected to the selected customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Delete Customer" button click on the Customer Records screen.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Signals that an SQLException has occurred in the event an issue occurs when updating the database.

    • onBackButton

      public void onBackButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onBackButton method loads the Appointments View screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Back to Appointments" button click on the Customer Records screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading AppointmentView.fxml happens.
